H0.text: It contains more than one cell is the statement that best describes a bacterial cell.

H1.text: It is a complete organism is the statement that best describes a bacterial cell.

H2.text: It is part of a larger organism is the statement that best describes a bacterial cell.

H3.text: It contains different kinds of cells is the statement that best describes a bacterial cell.

A4.text: Most bacterial species exist as single cells

A5.text: Bacteria do not have a membrane-bound nucleus, and their genetic material is typically a single circular bacterial chromosome of DNA located in the cytoplasm in an irregularly shaped body called the nucleoid
